io.foxtrot.android.sdk

Class FoxtrotSDK

  • Object
    • io.foxtrot.android.sdk.FoxtrotSDK

  • public final class FoxtrotSDK
extends Object
    This is the entry point for the FoxtrotSDK. 

    
 FoxtrotSDK.setup(context, "THE-API-KEY");
 FoxtrotSDK.getInstance().registerLoginCallback(loginCallback);
 FoxtrotSDK.getInstance().login(driver);

    See Also:
    LoginCallback, RouteStateListener, ErrorStateListener

                         String apiKey)
        Setup the FoxtrotSDK with the application context and apiKey
        Parameters:
        context - the application context
        apiKey - the api key

      • isSetup

        public static boolean isSetup()
        Returns:
        true if and only if setup(Context, String) has been successfully called.

        public static FoxtrotSDK getInstance()
        Access the FoxtrotSDK after it has been setup.
        See Also:
        setup(Context, String)

        public boolean isLoggedIn(@Nonnull
                          Driver driver)
        Check if the Driver has already logged in.
        Parameters:
        driver - - the driver to check
        Returns:
        true if the driver has already logged in

      • login

        public void login(@Nonnull
                  Driver driver)
        Log in the driver to Foxtrot. This method should be called after registerLoginCallback(LoginCallback)
        Parameters:
        driver - the driver to be logged in.
        See Also:
        registerLoginCallback(LoginCallback)

      • logout

        public void logout()
        Log out the current driver.

      • registerLoginCallback

        public void registerLoginCallback(@Nonnull
                                  LoginCallback loginCallback)
        Register the LoginCallback. This method should be called before login(Driver)
        Parameters:
        loginCallback - the login callback

      • unregisterLoginCallback

        public void unregisterLoginCallback(@Nonnull
                                    LoginCallback loginCallback)
        Unregister the LoginCallback.
        Parameters:
        loginCallback - the login callback

      • getImportedRouteNames

        public Map<String,String> getImportedRouteNames()
        Return the mapping from route id to route name for all routes assigned to this driver
        Returns:
        the map

      • addRoute

        public void addRoute(@Nonnull
                     Route route)
        Import a route to Foxtrot. This method should be called after registerRouteStateListener(RouteStateListener). The optimized route will be returned through the RouteStateListener.onRouteChanged(OptimizedRoute, EnumSet) callback.
        Parameters:
        route - the route
        See Also:
        registerRouteStateListener(RouteStateListener)

      • finishRoute

        public void finishRoute(@Nonnull
                        String routeId)
        Finish a route. If there are more routes to be completed, the new route will be returned through the RouteStateListener.onRouteChanged(OptimizedRoute, EnumSet) callback. If there are no more routes, then RouteStateListener.onAllRoutesFinished() will be invoked.
        Parameters:
        routeId - the route id

      • addDeliveryAttempt

        public void addDeliveryAttempt(@Nonnull
                               String waypointId,
                               @Nonnull
                               DeliveryAttempt attempt)
        Make a DeliveryAttempt on an OptimizedWaypoint. Once the DeliveryAttempt has been added, you will be informed of the changes to the route through the RouteStateListener.onRouteChanged(OptimizedRoute, EnumSet) callback.
        Parameters:
        waypointId - the waypoint id
        attempt - the attempt

      • authorizeDeliveryReattempt

        public void authorizeDeliveryReattempt(@Nonnull
                                       String waypointId,
                                       @Nonnull
                                       DeliveryReattempt reattempt)
        Authorize a DeliveryStatus.AUTHORIZE_REATTEMPT to a OptimizedWaypoint. A AUTHORIZE_REATTEMPT can only be authorized if there has been a DeliveryStatus.FAILED attempt to deliver to that OptimizedWaypoint. Once the status has been added, you will be informed of the changes to the route through the RouteStateListener.onRouteChanged(OptimizedRoute, EnumSet) callback.
        Parameters:
        waypointId - the waypoint id
        reattempt - the reattempt

      • markDeliveryToVisitLater

        public void markDeliveryToVisitLater(@Nonnull
                                     String waypointId,
                                     @Nonnull
                                     DeliveryVisitLater visitLater)
        Mark this OptimizedWaypoint to be visited later. Once the status has been added, you will be informed of the changes to the route through the RouteStateListener.onRouteChanged(OptimizedRoute, EnumSet) callback.
        Parameters:
        waypointId - the waypoint id
        visitLater - the visitLater

      • undoDeliveryAttempt

        public void undoDeliveryAttempt(@Nonnull
                                String waypointId)
        Undo the previous DeliveryAttempt that was made to an OptimizedWaypoint. Once the DeliveryAttempt has been undone, you will be informed of the changes to the route through the RouteStateListener.onRouteChanged(OptimizedRoute, EnumSet) callback.
        Parameters:
        waypointId - the waypoint id

      • registerRouteStateListener

        public void registerRouteStateListener(@Nonnull
                                       RouteStateListener routeStateListener)
        Register the RouteStateListener
        Parameters:
        routeStateListener - the route state listener

        Parameters:
        routeStateListener - the route state listener
